subject: History
title: The Maurya Empire of India
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Maurya Empire of India.

hook.text: Chandragupta Maurya overthrew a Greek successor state and built India's first great empire.

buildup.text: At its peak, the Maurya Empire ruled 50 million peopleâ€”the largest state in the ancient world.

discovery.text: Emperor Ashoka conquered Kalinga, saw the carnage, and renounced violence forever. He chose Buddhism.

twist.text: Ashoka then spread his edicts of compassion on stone pillars across India. A warrior became a pacifist.

climax.text: His lion capital pillar became modern India's national emblem. His wheel sits on India's flag.

punchline.text: India's greatest emperor was the one who stopped fighting.

quiz.question: Why did Emperor Ashoka renounce violence?
options: He lost a major battle to the Greeks
He was horrified by the carnage of the Kalinga war
Buddhist monks convinced him before a battle
